entry.et: Middle English bagage, from Middle French, from bagues belongings, baggage

def.dt: :suitcases, trunks, and personal belongings of travelers :luggage
:transportable equipment especially of a military force
:intangible things (as feelings, circumstances, or beliefs) that get in the way emotional baggage

entry.et: probably modification of Middle French bagasse, from Old Occitan bagassa

def.dt: :the area in an airport where arriving passengers pick up their checked baggage
